body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
d8d6463130d4:/# spack -v install intel-oneapi-tbb
==> Requeueing a build task for intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv with status 'queued'
==> Processing intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv: task=priority=0, status=dequeued, start=0, #dependencies=0
==> intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv is now write locked
==> Installing intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv
==> No binary for intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv found: installing from source
==> Creating the installation directory /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-alpine3-zen2/gcc-10.2.1/intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv
==> Fetching https://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/17759/l_tbb_oneapi_p_2021.2.0.357_offline.sh
######################################################################################################################################################################################################################################################### 100.0%
==> No patches needed for intel-oneapi-tbb
==> intel-oneapi-tbb: Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2021-06-10-01:53:02.419366] 'bash' 'l_tbb_oneapi_p_2021.2.0.357_offline.sh' '-s' '-a' '-s' '--action' 'install' '--eula' 'accept' '--log=log.txt' '--install-dir' '/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-alpine3-zen2/gcc-10.2.1/intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv'
./install.sh: line 18: ./bootstrapper: not found
==> Error: RuntimeError: install failed

/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/oneapi.py:82, in install:
         79                shutil.rmtree('/var/intel/installercache', ignore_errors=True)
         80
         81        # Some installers have a bug and do not return an error code when failing
  >>     82        if not isdir(join_path(prefix, self.component_dir)):
         83            raise RuntimeError('install failed')

See build log for details:
  /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv/spack-build-out.txt

d8d6463130d4:/# cat   /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv/spack-build-out.txt
==> intel-oneapi-tbb: Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2021-06-10-01:53:02.419366] 'bash' 'l_tbb_oneapi_p_2021.2.0.357_offline.sh' '-s' '-a' '-s' '--action' 'install' '--eula' 'accept' '--log=log.txt' '--install-dir' '/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-alpine3-zen2/gcc-10.2.1/intel-oneapi-tbb-2021.2.0-b74fi5psaoethon7pegbsyp4afvsvanv'
./install.sh: line 18: ./bootstrapper: not found
d8d6463130d4:/#
...
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```
d8d6463130d4:/# spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1
* **Python:** 3.8.10
* **Platform:** linux-alpine3-zen2
* **Concretizer:** original
d8d6463130d4:/#
```

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6627849/spack-built-env.txt)
[spack-build-01-install-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6627860/spack-build-01-install-out.txt)
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6627851/spack-built-out.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
Pinging @danvev & @rscohn2
### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: intel-oneapi-tbb in a container
